user.title: Select Sofabaton hub
user.description: Select the Sofabaton hub that was discovered on your network, or choose manual setup if yours isn’t listed.

manual.title: Manual hub setup
manual.description: Provide a name and IP address for your Sofabaton hub. The name you choose here will become the name of your virtual hub and cannot be changed later.

ports.title: Integration ports
ports.description: These ports are used by this integration and apply to all hubs.

data.hub_listen_base: TCP listener port base (for the physical hub to connect)
data.proxy_udp_port: UDP Listener port (for the app to connect)
data.roku_listen_port: HTTP listener port (for the hub to send button presses to Home Assistant)

data_description.hub_listen_base: Base TCP port the real hub connects to. Each configured hub uses one port from a 32-port range starting here.
data_description.proxy_udp_port: Shared UDP listener for official app discovery and handshake. Keep 8102 unless another service already uses it. Changing this port will break discovery in the official iOS app (Android is fine) and prevent it from connecting to your virtual hub.
data_description.roku_listen_port: Shared HTTP listener for WiFi device callbacks, so the Integration can receive button presses from the physical hub/remote. Changing this port has impact: 1. it will break X1 compatibility (X1S and X2 are fine). 2. If you have created Wifi Devices and commands already, changing this port now will cause those commands to stop working.

zeroconf_confirm.title: Discovered Sofabaton hub
zeroconf_confirm.description: Home Assistant found a Sofabaton hub ({{name}} @ {{host}}). Confirm to set it up.

abort.x2_disabled: SofaBaton X2 discovery is disabled. To enable it, add `enable_x2_discovery: true` under `sofabaton_x1s:` in configuration.yaml and restart Home Assistant.
